0.title: My unborn baby counts as passenger: US woman after being fined for carpool lane driving
0.article_body: A pregnant woman in US' Texas who was fined for driving solo in a carpool lane has said her unborn baby must be counted as a passenger. Brandy Bottone said her unborn child was a person in the eyes of the law as the US Supreme Court had days earlier reversed a federal law guaranteeing women access to abortion.

1.title: I was unsure whether it would work: Ranveer Singh on his OTT debut
1.article_body: Discussing his OTT debut with 'Ranveer vs Wild with Bear Grylls', Ranveer Singh said, "It was an experiment for me and I was unsure about whether it would work." "The good folks at Netflix...were way more confident than me," he added. "I was very excited to do something that hasn't been done before in the Indian entertainment space," stated Ranveer.

2.title: BJP looting people's money in name of development: Kumaraswamy
2.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy criticised the BJP-led government in the state and at the Centre by calling it 'pro-rich'. "BJP government is looting people's tax money in the name of development," said Kumaraswamy. He further stated that if poor people are harassed in the country, then we too might witness a response similar to that of Sri Lanka.

3.title: Picture abhi baaki hai: Unacademy CEO on firm's cost-cutting measures
3.article_body: Responding to a journalist's tweet about the recent cost-cutting measures at the firm, Unacademy's CEO Gaurav Munjal tweeted, "Picture abhi baaki hai. Abhi intermission hua hai." Munjal on Monday announced a series of cost-cutting measures to turn the firm profitable. The measures included founders and the top management taking a salary cut and free meals being prohibited in their offices.

4.title: Bharti Singh and Haarsh Limbachiyaa reveal 3-month-old son's face
4.article_body: Bharti Singh and Haarsh Limbachiyaa have shared a video on their YouTube channel, revealing the face of their three-month-old son, Laksh, for the first time. Sharing the video, Bharti asked her fans if Laksh looks like her or Haarsh. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "So adorable...surely got Bharti's face," while another fan wrote, "Laksh is blessed with...best parents."

5.title: Ms Marvel is a moment for Pakistan, a celebration of who we are: Director
5.article_body: Pakistani-Canadian filmmaker Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy, who helmed two episodes of 'Ms Marvel', spoke about how the show is a "moment for Pakistan". "So much of what you'd see...is a celebration of who we are and where we come from," she said. Sharmeen added the success of 'Black Panther' really pushed the narrative that superheroes could be in all colours and religions.

6.title: Delhi's neglected historical monuments to get facelift: Dy CM Sisodia
6.article_body: Delhi government has planned to give a facelift to its neglected historical monuments, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. While Malcha Mahal is set to get a makeover, museums will be set up at Dara Shikoh Library and Qudsia Bagh. Five monuments including, Birji Khan's Tomb, Bara Lao Ka Gumbad, Gol Gumbaz etc will be illuminated with tricolour lights, Sisodia said.

7.title: New UK PM to be announced on September 5
7.article_body: Britain's new PM will be announced on September 5, the ruling Conservative Party said. Eleven candidates have so far come forward in the race to replace Boris Johnson, who resigned last week after a revolt among his MPs and ministers. Johnson said that he'll not endorse any candidate running to replace him as he doesn't want to damage their chances.

8.title: England create history with 8-0 win over Norway in Women's Euro 2022
8.article_body: England defeated Norway by a record 8-0 margin in Women's Euro 2022 to register the biggest win in European Championship history. Notably, no side had ever scored eight goals in a single Euro match across men's and women's competitions. With the win, England have entered the quarter-finals after having won their first group stage game against Austria 1-0.

9.title: 15 key roads in south Delhi to be revamped for ₹23 cr: Sisodia
9.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has approved projects for the revamping of south Delhi's 15 road stretches at an estimated cost of ₹23.24 crore and the work will start soon. The stretches, which have a total length of 18.19 km, are located in several areas including Kalkaji, Greater Kailash, Malviya Nagar and Kasturba Nagar, officials said.

10.title: List of state-wise active COVID-19 cases released
10.article_body: The Health Ministry on Tuesday stated that there are 1,31,043 active COVID-19 cases in the country, with Kerala accounting for the highest number of active cases at 26,643. This is followed by West Bengal (24,209), Tamil Nadu (18,802), Maharashtra (18,027), Karnataka (6,718), Telangana (5,166), Gujarat (4,214), Odisha (3,084) and Uttar Pradesh (2,305).

11.title: Don't have time for trolls, people don't get what I say most of the times: RGV
11.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said he uses social media to talk about issues he is interested in and he does not have time for trolls. "I also feel most of the times, people don't get what I say and they tend to misunderstand me...I am always the first one to even apologise if I am wrong," he added.

12.title: Make education system more inclusive for special children: HC to Haryana
12.article_body: Punjab and Haryana HC asked the Haryana government to make the education system more inclusive for children with disabilities. HC was hearing a petition filed by a woman and her 16-year-old son with Down Syndrome, who was allegedly "maligned and expelled" from a school. The school alleged the boy's unruly and violent behaviour was the cause of his removal.

13.title: India reports 13,615 new COVID-19 cases, active cases rise to 1,31,043
13.article_body: India has reported 13,615 COVID-19 cases, 13,265 recoveries and 20 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,678 cases and 26 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,31,043, while the death toll reached 5,25,474.

14.title: SpiceJet MD booked for allegedly cheating Gurugram man, airline responds
14.article_body: Gurugram Police has booked SpiceJet Chairman and MD Ajay Singh for allegedly defrauding a businessman. The complainant, who's a consultant in the aviation sector, has accused Singh of delivering a fake depository instruction slip of 10 lakh shares for services provided to him. SpiceJet said the complaint is "mischievous and completely bogus" and intends to hurt SpiceJet and Singh's image.

15.title: Over 800 children died in specialised adoption agencies since 2018: Data
15.article_body: More than 800 children, maximum below the age of two, have died in state-run specialised adoption agencies since 2018, as per official data. The officials said that the main reason for the fatalities is unsafe abandonment, including children being found with dog bites. Of the total 819 children, 481 were girls and 129 those with special needs, according to data.

16.title: Rupee hits historic low of 79.57 against US dollar
16.article_body: The Indian rupee hit a historic low of 79.57 against the US dollar during early trade on Tuesday. On Monday, the currency had ended at another record low of 79.44 per US dollar and had witnessed an intra-day high of 79.24. Meanwhile, Sensex declined 305 points to 54,090 and Nifty slipped 108 points to 16,107 in early trade on Tuesday.

17.title: Uber Files whistleblower reveals himself
17.article_body: Mark MacGann, a career lobbyist who worked for Uber between 2014 and 2016, has revealed himself as the whistleblower who provided The Guardian with 1,24,000 company records that constitute The Uber Files. MacGann, a 52-year-old Irishman, served as Uber's chief lobbyist for Europe, the Middle East and Africa and oversaw government relations and public policy in more than 40 countries.

18.title: Ranbir did high intensity cardio, had low carb diet: Trainer on Shamshera
18.article_body: Talking about Ranbir Kapoor's fitness regime for 'Shamshera', his trainer Kunal Gir said, "We trained five days a week, each session was an hour-long, followed by a...high-intensity cardio session called 'truck'." "RK would hold the treadmill's handles...and drive the belt with his legs...Ranbir [had a low carb diet and] was allowed a cheat meal only once a week," he added.

19.title: 5 people arrested in Hyd Old City for stealing goats during Bakri Eid
19.article_body: Hyderabad police arrested five people for allegedly stealing goats a day before Bakri Eid. According to police, the five-member gang had stolen 23 goats kept at a house at Noori Nagar. The accused shifted the goats in an auto and sold them to customers at Pebbair area in Mahabubnagar, police said. They were apprehended with the help of CCTV footage.

20.title: I was illegally trafficked to UK aged 9, forced to work as child servant: Mo Farah
20.article_body: Multiple Olympic and world champion Mo Farah has revealed that he was illegally trafficked to Britain at the age of nine from Djibouti and forced to work as a child servant. The 39-year-old, who was born in Somalia, added his name had been changed to Mohamed Farah from Hussein Abdi Kahin in the fake travel documents.

21.title: Dwarka Expressway delayed, to now wrap up in 2023: Officials
21.article_body: The Dwarka Expressway, which is being built to reduce Delhi-Gurugram traffic on National Highway-8, has been delayed by at least a year due to COVID-19 pandemic, senior officials in National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) said. The expressway, which was earlier expected to be ready by this August, is now expected to be ready by September 2023, the officials said.

22.title: 3 senior Congress leaders join Aam Aadmi Party in Uttarakhand
22.article_body: Uttarakhand Pradesh Congress spokesman Rajendra Prasad Raturi, Pradesh Mahila Congress vice-president Kamlesh Raman and social media adviser Kuldip Chaudhary on Monday joined Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in Delhi. They were inducted into AAP in presence of Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia. The leaders said they quit Congress as infighting was increasing despite the party's rout in the state Assembly polls.

23.title: Gap's India-born CEO Sonia Syngal steps down after over two years
23.article_body: American clothing retail company Gap's India-born President and CEO Sonia Syngal is stepping down from her position just over two years into the role. The 52-year-old was appointed as CEO in March 2020. The company did not provide a reason for her sudden exit. Gap's Executive Chairman Bob Martin will step in as interim CEO effective immediately, the company said.

24.title: Kohli just needs one good innings to return back to form: Deep Dasgupta
24.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Deep Dasgupta has said Virat Kohli only needs one good innings to return back to form. "Whenever he's playing, it doesn't look like he's out of form. I don't feel he played a bad shot [in the third England T20I], maybe it was just his luck," added Dasgupta. Kohli scored 12 runs in two T20Is against England.

25.title: TMC leaders insulted Hindu Gods earlier too: Smriti Irani
25.article_body: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani reacted to TMC MP Mahua Moitra's "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark and said that it is not "impossible" for TMC MP to insult the goddess. "TMC leadership had in the past several times insulted Hindu Gods and Goddesses," she said during her visit to West Bengal's Howrah.

26.title: Measures to decongest Hebbal junction working: B'luru authorities
26.article_body: The Bengaluru city traffic police on Monday said that the measures taken to reduce congestion at Hebbal junction have yielded results and the commuters are saving eight to 10 minutes while crossing the flyover. "There is improvement in traffic movement," said BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath. Notably, the authorities have been tasked with finding ways to decongest the city.

27.title: Twitter user asks Mahindra about Tata Motors, he says 'Privilege to have such competitors'
27.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra responded to a Twitter user who asked him his feelings about Tata cars. Mahindra wrote, "It's a privilege to have strong competitors like Tata Motors. They keep reinventing themselves and that inspires us to do even better...Competition spurs innovation." Commenting on his tweet, a user wrote, "There are few people who praise [their] competitors."

28.title: Iran to send hundreds of drones to Russia for use in Ukraine: US
28.article_body: Iran is planning to send "hundreds" of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), including weapons-capable drones, to Russia for use in its ongoing war in Ukraine, US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said on Monday. US intelligence also indicates that Iran is preparing to begin training Russian forces on how to operate these drones as early as this month,  Sullivan added.

29.title: 2 minor boys engaged in child labour at 2 firms rescued in Hyd
29.article_body: The Sheteams of Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police along with the Muskan team have rescued two minor boys engaged in child labour at MGS packing solutions and SS Polymers Private Limited companies, the police said on Monday. The owners of the companies were counselled, the police added. The police further said that the companies are located under the Choutuppal Police Station limits.

30.title: Delhi govt starts issuing fine for violating plastic-ban
30.article_body: Delhi government has started penalising violators found using, selling, manufacturing or stocking single-use plastic items. They imposed a fine of ₹1.2 crore on 119 violators and seized 16,359 kg of banned plastic on Monday. The ban came into force on July 1 but offering a grace period of 10 days, government had said it'd penalise the violators from July 11.

31.title: Ex-sarpanch of village near Pune killed as wooden shed collapses on her
31.article_body: A 46-year-old former sarpanch of a village near Pune was killed after a wooden shed of her house collapsed on her on Monday amid heavy rains, police said. The incident took place when she was working in the space under the wooden structure, police added. The victim was rushed to a hospital where she succumbed to her injuries during treatment.

32.title: Pune's Alandi civic body head's daughter-in-law found dead; 3 booked
32.article_body: A case has been filed against Pune's Alandi Municipal Council chairperson, her husband and son following allegations of suicide due to harassment after her 24-year-old daughter-in-law was found dead. The deceased, who got married last year, was reportedly found hanging at her residence on Sunday evening. The body has been taken for post-mortem, the police said.

33.title: 7 die in 24 hrs as heavy rains lash Gujarat, over 9000 relocated; 468 rescued
33.article_body: At least seven people died in 24 hours as flood-like situation was caused following heavy rains lashing several parts of south and central Gujarat districts. Officials, on Monday, said that over 9,000 people were relocated and 468 were rescued. Dang, Navsari, Tapi, and Valsad districts in south Gujarat and Panchmahal, Chhotaudepur, and Kheda in central Gujarat were affected.

34.title: 'James Bond' theme composer Monty Norman passes away at 94
34.article_body: British composer Monty Norman, best known for writing the iconic theme music for the James Bond films, died on Monday at the age of 94, his official website announced. "It is with sadness we share the news that Monty Norman died on 11th July 2022 after a short illness," read the statement.

35.title: India's cricket squad for Commonwealth Games 2022 announced
35.article_body: The BCCI have announced India's cricket squad for the upcoming Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022, which will feature women's T20I cricket. The squad will be led by Harmanpreet Kaur, while Smriti Mandhana has been named the vice-captain. The squad includes Shafali Verma, Pooja Vastrakar, Harleen Deol and Jemimah Rodrigues, among others. India will face Australia on July 29.

36.title: Shaadi.com Founder offers to find Nagaland Minister a bride; he says 'Waiting for Salman'
36.article_body: After Nagaland Minister Temjen Imna Along confirmed that he's not married and shared a screenshot of Google query of people seeking to know about his wife, Shaadi.com Founder Anupam Mittal replied, "Will have to do something @ShaadiDotCom." Responding to Mittal's tweet, Temjen said, "Bhai filhal hum bindas hai (Brother, I'm fine right now). Waiting for Salman Bhai."

37.title: I still feel 'very unconfident' many days when I wake up: Ananya
37.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday said she "still feels very under-confident" on many days when she wakes up as she doesn't feel she looks good enough. "I have those moments all the time," added Ananya. "As soon as I started working, people started saying things like 'You should...get a boob job or change something about your face'," she had shared.

38.title: Bengaluru to become free of stray dogs soon: K'taka Minister
38.article_body: Karnataka Animal Husbandry Minister Prabhu Chavan on Monday said the animal husbandry department is looking at making Bengaluru free of stray dogs. This comes amid several reports of dog attacks and rabies in the city. "We are...planning to bring them under one shelter where they can be rescued and properly taken care of so...people don't get any...disturbance," said Chavan.

39.title: Didn't breach our obligations under merger agreement: Twitter to Musk
39.article_body: In a letter to Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter said it didn't breach its obligations under the merger agreement as stated by Musk after he terminated the $44 billion deal. It added that the agreement remained in place and it would take steps to close the deal. Twitter is reportedly planning to file a lawsuit early this week in Delaware.

40.title: Keep boxes of stones, pistols in shops: BJP leader to traders on Nupur row
40.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party legislator Vikram Saini, while addressing gathering of traders in Uttar Pradesh, asked them to keep boxes of stones, shovel bents and pistols in their shops. His comments came over ongoing controversy regarding suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma's remarks against Prophet Muhammad. "By the time the police come, they set your shops and houses on fire," he added.

41.title: Retired B'luru professor sues SBI over cyber fraud, wins ₹13 lakh
41.article_body: A 65-year-old retired professor of Bangalore University sued the State Bank of India after he lost ₹13 lakh of his retirement fund in a cyber fraud incident. The bank initially refused to refund saying the complaint was not made within three days of the crime, a requirement laid by the RBI. However, the court ruled in favour of the man.

42.title: Preservation of stone plaques of Mumbai's 150-yr-old Carnac Bridge likely
42.article_body: The Central Railway has said that they would try and preserve original stone plaques of Mumbai's 150-year-old Carnac Bridge. The preservation will possibly be done at the indoor or outdoor heritage galleries at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) or may even be embedded into the new bridge design. The bridge has reportedly been declared dangerous by IIT-Bombay in its audit.

43.title: Security guard shoots 22-yr-old man dead on suspicion of theft in Delhi
43.article_body: A 46-year-old security guard allegedly shot dead a 22-year-old man on suspicion of theft at a construction site in Delhi's Shahdara, police said. The accused found the victim and his friend roaming inside the premises and allegedly fired at them, police added. The deceased's friend told police that they had gone to the construction site to steal iron rods.

44.title: Deepest image of the early universe ever taken released by NASA
44.article_body: NASA has said that the first image from its James Webb Space Telescope is the deepest and sharpest infrared image of the distant universe to date. "Known as Webb's First Deep Field, this image of galaxy cluster SMACS 0723 is overflowing with detail. Thousands of galaxies have appeared in Webb's view for the first time," NASA added.

45.title: Twitter calls Musk's withdrawal 'invalid & wrongful', says he 'knowingly' breached deal
45.article_body: Twitter has sent a letter to Tesla CEO Elon Musk after he terminated the $44 billion acquisition deal. Terming his withdrawal as "invalid and wrongful”, Twitter said Musk "knowingly" breached the deal. "Twitter demands that Musk and...other Musk Parties comply with their obligations under the Agreement...to consummate and make effective the transactions contemplated by the Agreement," it added.

46.title: 9 cm tumour removed from 60-year-old patient's brain in Bhopal
46.article_body: A 9 cm tumour was removed from a 60-year-old patient's brain by a team of 10 doctors at a private hospital in Bhopal after a five-hour surgery, according to media reports. The tumour had reportedly spread to a quarter of the patient's brain. The man had fainted, after which the tumour was detected in an MRI scan, as per reports.

47.title: Security law use threatens Hong Kong's business hub status: US Envoy
47.article_body: Consul General of the US to Hong Kong Hanscom Smith on Monday warned China that the "crude and chilling" use of the Hong Kong national security law has endangered the city's international business hub status. "True patriotism is earned by winning the allegiance of free people, rather than futile efforts to legislate 'patriotism' and loyalty from above," Smith said.

48.title: S Africa confirms 3rd monkeypox case in tourist from Switzerland
48.article_body: South African health authorities have reported the third confirmed case of monkeypox in the country. The infected 42-year-old man is a tourist from Switzerland who showed symptoms including a rash, muscle ache and fatigue. "Three contacts have already been identified and none of them has developed signs thus far," a health official said in a statement.

49.title: EU recommends second COVID-19 booster dose for people over 60
49.article_body: EU health agencies on Monday recommended a second booster shot of COVID-19 vaccines for people over the age of 60 years and immunocompromised individuals. "We are currently seeing increasing COVID-19 case notification rates and an increasing trend in hospital and ICU admissions...driven by the BA.5 sublineage of Omicron," director of the European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control said.

50.title: PIL filed against Mamata in Calcutta HC over her 'jihad' remark
50.article_body: A PIL has been filed at the Calcutta High Court against West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee over her comments saying that Trinamool Congress will declare 'jihad' against BJP in the upcoming Martyrs' Day event. State Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar recently wrote to the CM asking her to withdraw her comments. The petitioner's counsel called the comments 'unwarranted.'

51.title: 9 suspended after pregnant woman bled outside health centre
51.article_body: In Assam, nine health workers, including a doctor, have been suspended after a woman started bleeding due to labour pain outside a locked primary health centre. The video of the incident went viral on social media and resulted in district authorities taking action. The incident occurred at Khepre primary health centre in Assam's Dima Hasao district.

52.title: Bomb hurled inside Pakistani Senator's house by unknown assailants
52.article_body: A bomb was hurled inside the house of an Awami National Party Senator, Haji Hidayatullah, on Sunday in Pakistan's Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province, as per local media reports. No casualties have been reported due to the incident. The bomb was locally-manufactured and it was thrown inside the house by unknown assailants on a motorcycle, police said.

53.title: Kyrgios is a tennis genius, unbelievable player: Djokovic's coach Ivanisevic
53.article_body: Novak Djokovic's coach Goran Ivanisevic praised Nick Kyrgios, saying the Australian is a "genius, tennis genius." He added, "Kyrgios, for me, is the best server in the game by far. Unbelievable tennis player." Kyrgios lost to Novak Djokovic 6-4, 3-6, 4-6, 6-7(3-7) in Wimbledon final on Sunday. He was playing in his maiden Grand Slam singles final.

54.title: Mahira homebuyers in Gurugram demand delivery of flats before Diwali
54.article_body: Around 100 homebuyers of Mahira Homes in Gurugram's Sector 68 held a protest on Sunday, demanding delivery of their flats before Diwali in October. The Department of Town and Country Planning cancelled the project's licence in May, alleging the developer submitted fabricated bank guarantees and forged bank officials' signatures. The licence was cancelled when 80% of construction was complete.

55.title: My only house set on fire, it had 200-yr-old paintings & 2,500 books: Lankan PM
55.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe on Monday addressed the arson attack on his home by protesters amid a raging economic crisis in the country. He said people with a "Hitler-like mindset torch buildings", adding, "My only house was set on fire. I had 2,500 books...my only asset." He said, "There were over 200-year-old valuable paintings. All of them destroyed."

56.title: We got a lot of lessons out of SL Tests to take to India next year: Cummins
56.article_body: Australia skipper Pat Cummins said the experience of playing Tests on two vastly different pitches in Sri Lanka would be important in their preparations for touring India next year. Australia won first Test by 10 wickets and lost second by an innings and 39 runs in Galle. "It's a good reality check for people touring over here," he added.

57.title: RBI fines three cooperative banks for non-compliance
57.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has fined three co-operative banks for non-compliance with certain guidelines. Nasik Merchant's Co-operative Bank was fined ₹50 lakh as it continued to accept fresh deposits in existing accounts of other non-scheduled urban co-operative banks. Maharashtra State Co-operative Bank was fined ₹37.5 lakh and The National Central Cooperative Bank in Bihar ₹2 lakh.

58.title: GSP Crop Science plans ₹500 crore IPO next year, says MD
58.article_body: Agro-chemical firm GSP Crop Science is planning to launch a ₹500 crore initial public offering (IPO) by next year, according to its Managing Director Bhavesh Shah. The Ahmedabad-based company plans to soon file a draft red herring prospectus with capital markets regulator SEBI, he said. Its revenue stood at ₹1,350 crore during the 2021-22 financial year, he added.

59.title: Gurugram Police files FIR against SpiceJet MD Ajay Singh
59.article_body: The Gurugram Police has filed an FIR against SpiceJet MD Ajay Singh over a complaint accusing him of delivering fake share certificates. The complainant, Amit Arora, alleged that Singh delivered a fake depository instruction slip worth ₹10 lakh for services provided to him. The police filed a complaint under Section 406 and 420 of the Indian Penal Code.

60.title: Emblem atop new Parliament was handcrafted by 100 artisans, took 9 months to finish
60.article_body: The 21-foot (6.5 metres) tall National Emblem that has been installed on top of the new Parliament building in Delhi was handcrafted by over 100 artisans who worked for over nine months to create it, government officials have said. The statue, installed 108 feet above the ground on Parliament's central foyer, weighs 16,000 kg with the emblem weighing 9,500 kg.

61.title: Woman poses as PA of ministers to cheat people, arrested in West Bengal
61.article_body: A woman has been arrested in West Bengal's Sonarpur for allegedly duping at least 10-12 people by promising them apartments. The accused identified herself as the personal assistant of Transport Minister Firhad Hakim and MoS for Finance Chandrima Bhattacharya, police said. She was arrested from her house on Sunday evening after a complaint was filed by a retired government employee.

62.title: I am absolutely against players taking rest: Sunil Gavaskar
62.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar has said he is "absolutely" against players taking rest. "You can't rest in IPL...but you want to rest when you play for India?" he questioned. He added, "If they want to take a rest, they can, but then all...guarantees should be taken away from them. The board needs to draw a line if they want to be professional."

63.title: Fan shares videos of theatre stopping 'Rocketry...' screening; Madhavan reacts
63.article_body: Actor R Madhavan has reacted after a fan shared videos complaining that a theatre in Kolkata stopped the ongoing screening of a show of his directorial 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect'. In the clip,  people asked for a refund. Resharing the post, Madhavan tweeted, "There must have been a genuine reason and cause. Please...be calm and show some love people."

64.title: We're nearing deal to buy cheaper diesel from Russia: Brazil Prez
64.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Monday that the country is nearing a deal to buy diesel at a low cost from Russia, however, he didn't provide any details about the deal. Bolsonaro's remarks come as the state-run oil company Petrobras announced a hike in fuel prices last month. Notably, presidential elections will be held in Brazil this year.

65.title: Gavaskar defends Kohli, says 'When Rohit doesn't score runs, no one talks about it'
65.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has defended Virat Kohli over criticism of his poor form. "I don't understand when Rohit Sharma does not score runs, no one talks about it," Gavaskar said. He added, "When other batters don't score runs, no one talks about it. Form is temporary and class is permanent. You are only asking about one player."

66.title: Over 800 children died in state-run adoption agencies since 2018
66.article_body: Over 800 children have died in state-run specialised adoption agencies since 2018, as per official data. According to officials, most of these deaths have been of children below 2 years of age and the main reason cited was "unsafe abandonment." Of 819 children, 481 were girls and 129 were those with special needs or disabled children who required extra help.

67.title: Thousands of diyas lit ahead of PM Modi's visit in Jharkhand
67.article_body: People lit thousands of diyas ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's arrival in Jharkhand's Deoghar on Monday. PM Modi will inaugurate and lay the foundation stone of various developmental projects worth over ₹16,000 crore in Deoghar, which is a famous pilgrimage site in the state. PM Modi will pay obeisance at the Lord Shiva temple in Deoghar.

68.title: SC to hear Bhima Koregaon-accused Varavara Rao's bail plea tomorrow
68.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear the permanent medical bail plea of Varavara Rao, an accused in the 2018 Bhima Koregaon case, on Tuesday, July 12. Activist and poet Rao has challenged the judgement of the Bombay High Court which rejected his plea for permanent bail. The court, however, extended the time he could surrender at Taloja jail by 3 months.

69.title: Jonny Bairstow, Marizanne Kapp named ICC Players of the Month for June
69.article_body: The ICC voted England batter Jonny Bairstow the men's Player of the Month for June 2022. In June, Bairstow helped England defeat New Zealand 3-0 in the three-match Test series. Meanwhile, South Africa's Marizanne Kapp was voted ICC women's Player of the Month. Kapp won ahead of fellow South African Shabnim Ismail and England batter Nat Sciver.

70.title: If rising population a threat, why is China doing well: Tejashwi Yadav
70.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Monday stated that China is ahead of India in terms of the economy and GDP despite being the most populous country. "If the rising population is a threat, then why is China doing so well?" Yadav added. A United Nations report stated that India is projected to become the world's most populous country next year.

71.title: Trump's ex-aide agrees to testify before Capitol riot probe panel
71.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's ex-advisor Steve Bannon has agreed to testify before the congressional committee probing the Capitol riot, days ahead of his trial for contempt of Congress. As per Reuters, Bannon's lawyer has written to the committee saying that Trump would waive the claim of executive privilege which had been cited by Bannon for refusal to testify earlier.

72.title: Delhi court summons Leena Manimekalai over 'Kaali' poster row
72.article_body: Delhi's Tis Hazari Court has issued summons to 'Kaali' filmmaker Leena Manimekalai and asked her to appear before the court on August 6. The petition, filed by Advocate Raj Gaurav, claims that the film's poster depicting a Hindu goddess smoking has hurt religious sentiments. The plea also seeks a permanent and mandatory injunction against the filmmaker.

73.title: Putin signs decree giving all Ukrainians path to Russian citizenship
73.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday issued a decree to fast-track citizenship for all Ukrainians "in a simplified manner" amid the ongoing conflict. Putin had already fast-tracked the Russian citizenship process in Ukraine's Kherson and Zaporizhzhia, which are partially under Russian control. Several parts of Donbas, which include Luhansk and Donetsk, are also under Russian control.

74.title: Mom rarely likes my films; told me 'What a film!' after watching Gupt: Kajol
74.article_body: Speaking about her mother's reaction after watching 'Gupt', actress Kajol Devgn said, "I remember my mother (Tanuja) telling me, 'Oh my God, what a film!'. And that's the highest accolade that I can get because my mother rarely likes my films." "She'd like my performances but not films...It was also the time when there was nothing else (mediums)," she added.

75.title: Judgment doesn't scare me but hope not to get unfair criticism: Arjun
75.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor said that one is judged almost every day for being a public figure. "The judgment doesn't scare me but I think unfair criticism is something I hope I don't get," he added. The actor further said a bit of that has happened to him but he has worked hard on himself and the choices he has made.

76.title: I don't take any win for granted: Djokovic after winning 7th Wimbledon title
76.article_body: Following his seventh Wimbledon title after defeating world number 45 Nick Kyrgios 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3), world number seven Novak Djokovic said he does not take any win for granted and "particularly not at Wimbledon." He added, "On the contrary, actually, every time feels a bit different, special in its own way." Notably, it was Djokovic's 21st Grand Slam title.

77.title: It was a gutsy choice: Kajol on playing a negative role in 'Gupt'
77.article_body: Speaking about playing a negative character in the film 'Gupt', actress Kajol Devgn said, "It was the shock value of the film, the character and the fact that nobody expected it to come. It was gutsy at that time to do." "It’s the story and role that’s what really got me to do it," Kajol said.

78.title: Video of PM unveiling National Emblem statue atop new Parliament building released
78.article_body: A video of PM Narendra Modi unveiling the handcrafted bronze statue of India's National Emblem on top of the new Parliament building in Delhi has been released by the government. The 6.5-metre installation is made from high-purity bronze, officials said. India's state emblem is an adaptation from the Sarnath Lion Capital of Emperor Ashoka.

79.title: Haryana Police STF arrests 5 members of Lawrence Bishnoi gang
79.article_body: The Special Task Force of Haryana Police on Monday said that it has arrested five members of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang from Bahadurgarh. Among those arrested are Chiraag, who is handling the drug trade of the Bishnoi gang and the younger brother of Tinu Bhiwani, arrested in the Sidhu Moosewala murder case and Manoj Bakkarwala, the country's famous car thief.

80.title: Delhi govt launches 15-day plantation drive in the city
80.article_body: The Delhi government on Monday launched a 15-day plantation drive in the national capital. The 'Van Mahotsav' plantation drive started from the Central Ridge and will conclude with the planting of one lakh saplings at the Asola Bhatti Wildlife Sanctuary on July 25, Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai said. Around 35 lakh saplings were planted in Delhi in 2021-22.

81.title: How does the WTC points table read as India slip to 5th?
81.article_body: After defeating Australia by an innings and 39 runs, Sri Lanka jumped to the third position on the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 54.17% of points won. Meanwhile, India have slipped to the fifth position with 52.08% of points won. South Africa are on top of the table with 71.43% of points won, while Australia are second.

82.title: Comedians in India get slapped with sedition and defamation: Vir Das
82.article_body: On Monday, comedian Vir Das shared a clip on Instagram from his old standup show. In the clip, Vir joked about how in India, comedians often get penalised for "hurting sentiments". Vir said, "You come to an Indian comic and...tell us a comedian got slapped, we don't ask ‘by who?’ we ask 'with what?'" He then added "Sedition [or] defamation."

83.title: India's ferocity took us by surprise: Mott on England's T20I series loss
83.article_body: Speaking about England's 1-2 loss against India in three-match T20I series, England white-ball head coach Matthew Mott stated that India's ferocity of their attacking mindset took his side by surprise. "We learned a lot of lessons in the first two games," he added. England lost first two T20Is by 50 and 49 runs. They won third T20I by 17 runs.

84.title: 12 Goa Congress MLAs ready to join BJP: CT Ravi
84.article_body: BJP General Secretary CT Ravi on Monday claimed that 12 Goa Congress MLAs are ready to leave the party and join BJP. Ravi, who is BJP's in-charge of Goa, added that many Congress leaders and legislators are in contact with the BJP. Congress said it was seeking disqualification of party leaders Michael Lobo and Digambar Kamat from the Goa Assembly.

85.title: Sri Lanka will elect new Prez on July 20 as Gotabaya to step down
85.article_body: Sri Lankan parliament will elect a new president on July 20 to succeed President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, Speaker Mahinda Yapa Abeywardana announced on Monday. The decision, which was taken at an all-party meet earlier today, comes as Rajapaksa will formally resign from the post on July 13. Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe's office also confirmed that the entire Cabinet will resign.

86.title: Will not endorse anyone running to replace me as PM: Boris Johnson
86.article_body: Britain's caretaker PM Boris Johnson on Monday said that he will not endorse any contender in the race to replace him as the PM as that would damage their chances of winning. He added, "Whoever takes over from me, there is a great agenda to be continued...my job is to continue with the programme on which we were elected."

87.title: Public won't be affected by inflation in Delhi: CM Kejriwal
87.article_body: Responding to the increases in the prices of power production in Delhi, CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that the public will not be affected by the inflation in the city. The state government will continue its electricity subsidy scheme, providing 200 units of free electricity, he said. Those utilising 201 to 400 units of electricity receive approximately 50% subsidy.

88.title: I don't think I need the tennis, I am happy with the little things: Roger Federer
88.article_body: Ex-world number one Roger Federer, who last played competitive tennis at Wimbledon in 2021, said he doesn't think he needs the tennis. "I'm happy with the little things, like when my son does something right and when my daughter comes home with a good grade," he added. Federer stated, "I know a professional career can't last forever and that's okay."

89.title: Paytm record 8.5 million loans in Q1, 492% higher than last year
89.article_body: Mobile payment company Paytm said it recorded 8.5 million loans in first quarter of FY23, 492% higher than the same period last year. Paytm's disbursements crossed an Annualised Run Rate (ARR) of ₹24,000 crore on the platform. In June, the super app saw its highest monthly transacting users of 76 million, a 49% increase from year ago period.

90.title: Bank privatisation bill could be introduced in Monsoon Session: Report
90.article_body: The government could introduce a bill for privatisation of select-public sector banks in the upcoming Monsoon Session of the Parliament, CNBC TV18 reported. The government is awaiting the views of the Law Ministry on the proposed bill, the report said. The government may lower the minimum stake in public sector banks from 51% at present to 26%, the report added.

91.title: Was born with umbilical cord wrapped around my neck, had broken nose: Lauren
91.article_body: American dancer, actress Lauren Gottlieb opened up about her experience in a rebirth moment. She said that she was born with her umbilical cord wrapped around her neck and added that she had a slightly broken nose at birth. Lauren said that she took some time for introspection and prioritised her life with family, and her own welfare above work.

92.title: IOC, BPCL, HPCL may post combined ₹10,700 cr loss in Q1: Report
92.article_body: Indian Oil Corporation, Bharat Petroleum and Hindustan Petroleum may post a combined loss of ₹10,700 crore in June quarter, ICICI Securities said in a report. The three state-owned oil marketing companies are losing ₹12-14 per litre on petrol and diesel, the report said. "We estimate gross refining margins to remain fairly strong at $17-18 per barrel levels," the brokerage added.

93.title: Virat Kohli to miss first ODI against England due to suspected groin injury: Reports
93.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli has reportedly sustained a groin injury and is unlikely to play the first ODI against England, as per reports. Kohli did not come for the optional practice today ahead of the first ODI at Kennington Oval, reports added. The first ODI will take place tomorrow.

94.title: Temples submerge near Godavari river after rains in Maha's Nashik
94.article_body: Various temples submerged near the Godavari river in Maharashtra's Nashik due to incessant rain for the past three days. Several parts of Maharashtra have witnessed heavy rainfall over the past few days. Nashik received 68.4 mm average rainfall over the last 24 hours and it is likely to experience very heavy rainfall till Thursday.

95.title: Lulu's biggest Indian mall opens in UP, is made with ₹2,000cr & has 11-storey parking
95.article_body: Lulu Group's biggest Indian mall made with a ₹2,000 crore investment and spread over a 22 lakh square feet area has opened in UP's Lucknow. The mall, which has 11-storey parking, was inaugurated by UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Sunday. It has a food court with a seating capacity of around 1,600 people with 15 fine dining restaurants and cafes.

96.title: Sanjay's 'Munnabhai' character was inspired by my character in Tezaab: Anil
96.article_body: Actor Anil Kapoor said in an interview that his character Munna in the 1988 hit 'Tezaab' inspired Rajkumar Hirani to write Sanjay Dutt's 'Munnabhai MBBS'. Anil mentioned his roles like 'Prem' from 'Woh Saat Din'...and 'Munna' from 'Tezaab'. He then elaborated about Munna and said, "Films were made on him because the character became so famous that they made...Munna Bhai."

97.title: What are the highest individual scores in last 10 overs of an ODI chase?
97.article_body: New Zealand's Michael Bracewell broke the record for registering the highest individual score in the last 10 overs (41 to 50) of an ODI chase. The 31-year-old scored 86 runs in the last 10 overs against Ireland to set the record. The previous record was held by Pakistan's Fakhar Zaman, who had scored 77 runs against South Africa in 2021.

98.title: Why did Djokovic's world ranking fall from 3rd to 7th despite winning Wimbledon?
98.article_body: Novak Djokovic's world ranking fell from third to seventh spot despite him winning Wimbledon. This is Djokovic's worst ranking in over four years. ATP decided to strip ranking points from Wimbledon in response to their decision to ban Russian and Belarusian players over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. As a result, Djokovic lost 2,000 points, the most among men's singles players.

99.title: CRPF jawan holds his family hostage for 18 hrs, later shoots self
99.article_body: A CRPF jawan allegedly held his wife and six-year-old daughter hostage for more than 18 hours and fired several rounds in the air from his machine gun, before shooting himself dead in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. Jodhpur Commissioner Ravi Gaur informed that the deceased's wife and daughter are safe. As per reports, the jawan had an altercation with his senior regarding leaves.

100.title: CBI files chargesheet against MHA officials in FCRA bribery case
100.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed a chargesheet against seven Home Ministry officials, among others, arrested in a Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA) bribery case, officials said. It is alleged that several officials were involved in exchanging bribes for facilitating clearances of foreign donations to NGOs in alleged violation of FCRA rules, officials had earlier said.

101.title: Bengal student leader Anis Khan was not murdered: SIT chargesheet
101.article_body: The Special Investigation Team (SIT) of West Bengal Police, probing student leader Anis Khan's death, on Monday ruled out murder as alleged by his family. The SIT, in its chargesheet, said Khan died after falling from the second floor of his home in Howrah on February 19. It has named five police personnel, charging them of negligence towards duty.

102.title: Arrest warrant was issued against me for disrobing Drapuadi: Puneet
102.article_body: Actor Puneet Issar, who portrayed Duryodhan in television series 'Mahabharat', revealed that a non-bailable arrest warrant was issued against him over the 'cheer haran' of Draupadi. "Someone from [Varanasi] had said that the disrobing of Draupadi that you did has caused hurt to us," he said. Puneet added that the person had wanted pictures with the actors of the show.

103.title: It lacked great brilliance: Toni Nadal on Djokovic-Kyrgios Wimbledon final
103.article_body: Analysing 2022 Wimbledon final between winner Novak Djokovic and runner-up Nick Kyrgios, Rafael Nadal's uncle Toni Nadal said it lacked great brilliance because there were too many points not played. He added that Djokovic once again proved that he is a great champion without the need to display his most "dazzling" game. Djokovic won his seventh Wimbledon title on Sunday.

104.title: Ready to lead new govt: Sri Lankan Oppn party SJB amid protests
104.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition party Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) on Monday said that it's ready to lead new government to bring stability amid ongoing protests due to country's economic crisis. The announcement, which was made by SJB leader Sajith Premadasa, came after PM Ranil Wickremesinghe's office said that entire Cabinet will resign. Sri Lankan President will step down on July 13.

105.title: Shinzo Abe's party wins majority in polls held after his assassination
105.article_body: Ex-Japanese PM Shinzo Abe's Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), which is also Japan's ruling party, has bagged a majority in the parliamentary polls held two days after his assassination. LDP-Komeito coalition has secured 76 seats in the upper house of the parliament. Abe was campaigning for an LDP candidate in Nara city when he was shot dead on July 8.

106.title: Haryana govt increases security of MLAs who received threat calls
106.article_body: The Haryana government has increased the security of MLAs who have allegedly received death threats over phone calls recently. Haryana Legislative Assembly Speaker GC Gupta said, "Our five-six MLAs have received death threats. We're taking this seriously." Gupta added that he has discussed the matter with Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar and the Director General of Police.

107.title: Scam 1992 fame Shreya takes Mumbai train; complains of unreasonable cab fares
107.article_body: 'Scam 1992' fame Shreya Dhanwanthary visited the southern part of Mumbai. She posted how she travelled via train as it's way cheaper and takes way less time than the "unreasonable cabs". Shreya wrote on Instagram Story, “Local beats unreasonable cab fares and travel time. The fare was ₹1500!!! What in the world? What do they think?"

108.title: Massive congratulations: Jayawardena on SL's innings and 39-run win vs Aus
108.article_body: After Sri Lanka won second Test by an innings and 39 runs against Australia in Galle, Mahela Jayawardena tweeted, "Well played Sri Lanka." He added, "Massive congratulations to Dimuth Karunarathna, the team and support staff. Also to the selectors who had to make some tough decisions with COVID cases in the squad." The two-match series ended in a 1-1 draw.

109.title: Varun Dhawan celebrates 8 years of 'Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania'
109.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan took to Instagram Stories on Monday to share a series of posts to mark eight years since the release of 'Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania'. He wrote alongside one of the pictures, "Some great memories with amazing people." The film also features actress Alia Bhatt and late actor Sidharth Shukla. Varun also shared director Shashank Khaitan's story.

110.title: Fabulous innings, shame it came in a losing cause: Giles on Suryakumar's 117
110.article_body: Ex-England spinner Ashley Giles called India batter Suryakumar Yadav's 55-ball 117 in the third T20I against England "fabulous". He added, "Just a shame it came in a losing cause." India lost by 17 runs. He further said that Suryakumar played classy innings under pressure after India were reduced to 31/3. He hit 14 fours and six sixes during his knock.

111.title: RBI unveils mechanism to settle international trade payments in Indian rupee
111.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Monday unveiled a system for international trade settlements in the Indian rupee. The new system will be put in place to "promote the growth of global trade" and "support the increasing interest of the global trading community in INR", RBI said. The system allows for invoicing, payment and settlement of exports/imports in INR.

112.title: Jubliant FoodWorks' ex-CEO Pota to lead Advent-backed Eureka Forbes
112.article_body: Pratik Pota, the former CEO of Jubilant FoodWorks Ltd (JFL), will lead Advent International's portfolio company, Eureka Forbes. Pota will take on the role of Managing Director and CEO of Eureka Forbes from August 16 and lead the management team to continue scaling the business, Advent announced. Before JFL, he held leadership roles in PepsiCo, Airtel and Hindustan Unilever.

113.title: Man lands small plane on busy highway in US after engine failure, video goes viral
113.article_body: A video has gone viral online showing a man landing a single-engine plane on a busy highway in US after the engine started to fail. The video was filmed on the pilot's GoPro camera. In the video, several cars can be seen travelling on the four-lane highway in North Carolina. The man had less than 100 hours of air experience.

114.title: I watched Chak De India to stay motivated for Shabaash Mithu: Taapsee
114.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said that she watched 'Chak De India' to get motivation for her film 'Shabaash Mithu'. "I need encouragement or inspiration. For this film, especially 'Shabaash Mithu', there were so many times I used to tell my colleagues...we should watch 'Chak De' before we start filming our climax to get into that zone," she said.

115.title: Sena's 16 MPs tell Uddhav to back NDA's President pick Murmu: MP
115.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Gajanan Kirtikar said 16 MPs of the party, who had attended a meeting called by Uddhav Thackeray on Monday, requested the former Maharashtra CM to support NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. "She is an NDA candidate but Droupadi Murmu belongs to the tribal community and is a woman," ANI quoted Kirtikar as saying.

116.title: Congress MP Manish Tewari refuses to sign Oppn's letter on Agnipath
116.article_body: Congress MP Manish Tewari on Monday refused to sign a letter by the Opposition against Agnipath scheme. Tewari, who was one of the seven Opposition MPs to meet Defence Minister Rajnath Singh earlier today, was the only one to not sign letter that sought withdrawal or scrutiny of scheme. Notably, Tewari had earlier termed the scheme "reform in right direction".

117.title: 4 more dead in Amarnath cloudburst identified as Rajasthan residents
117.article_body: Four more people killed in the July 8 Amarnath flash floods have been identified as residents of Rajasthan's Nagaur. With this, the death toll in the incident from the state rose to seven. At least 16 people died and several went missing in the flash floods triggered by a cloudburst last Friday.

118.title: Punjab govt cancels textile park near Ludhiana's Mattewara forest
118.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann announced on Monday that the proposed 1,000-acre textile park project near Ludhiana's Mattewara forest has been cancelled. He further said that no industry will be allowed to come up on the river banks of Punjab to avoid any sort of water pollution. This comes after over 10,000 people assembled at the project site in protest.

119.title: Meat thrown in gurdwara premises in UP's Bareilly; case lodged
119.article_body: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly have registered a case after meat was allegedly thrown into the premises of a gurdwara, a senior police officer said on Monday. Some miscreants tried to spoil the atmosphere of the city on Sunday night amid Eid al-Adha celebrations, he added. Police said a crowd had gathered at the spot after the meat was found.

120.title: G20 watchdog to propose first global crypto rules in October
120.article_body: The Financial Stability Board (FSB) said on Monday that it'll propose the first global cryptocurrency rules in October, following the recent market volatility. "The failure of a market player, in addition to imposing...large losses on investors...can...transmit risks to other parts of the crypto-asset ecosystem," FSB said. The FSB will report to G20 Finance Ministers and central bank Governors.

121.title: 'Population imbalance' shouldn't be allowed to happen: UP CM Yogi
121.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said the population control programme must go ahead successfully, adding that "population imbalance" should not be allowed to happen. Having skilled manpower is an achievement for society, but when there are diseases and a shortage of resources, population explosion becomes a challenge of its own, the CM's office tweeted in Hindi.

122.title: Shinzo Abe's attacker referred to YouTube to make firearms: Reports
122.article_body: Tetsuya Yamagami, the attacker who shot dead ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe on July 8, referred to YouTube videos while making the firearm used in the attack, local media reported. Yamagami said he had tested the gun at a facility connected to a religious group he believes Abe was associated with. Abe was killed while delivering a speech in Nara city.

123.title: Bengaluru school shut for 2 years denying TCs to students: Report
123.article_body: Godwin English School in Bengaluru, which has been defunct for the last two years, hasn't issued transfer certificates (TCs) to 25 students, The News Minute reported. However, school authorities have reportedly been calling parents to demand money for the issuance of the certificates. The students have reportedly been unable to secure admissions elsewhere for two years because of this reason.

124.title: FIR against unidentified persons over objectionable hoardings on PM Modi
124.article_body: Police have filed an FIR against unidentified persons after objectionable hoardings and comments on Prime Minister Narendra Modi came up opposite police lines in Uttar Pradesh's Colonelganj. The hoardings featured the hashtag #ByeByeModi and included references to the revoked farm laws, contract jobs and the rising cost of cooking gas. Police are scanning CCTV footage to identify those involved.

125.title: Crypto lender Celsius considers bankruptcy filing: Report
125.article_body: Cryptocurrency lender Celsius is considering filing for bankruptcy as it hired new lawyers for restructuring advice, The Wall Street Journal reported. The crypto firm has brought on lawyers from Kirkland & Ellis LLP to advise on options, including a bankruptcy filing, the report said. This comes after the company froze customer transfers and withdrawals citing "extreme market conditions".

126.title: Babar Azam looks a million dollars in modern-day cricket: Younis
126.article_body: Ex-Pakistan skipper Waqar Younis lauded Babar Azam, saying that the Pakistan captain looks like a "million dollars" in modern-day cricket. "He's definitely as good as all the big names. Babar is still very young and has plenty of cricket ahead of him," he added. In ICC batting rankings, Babar is currently ranked fourth in Tests, first in ODIs and T20Is.

127.title: Sidhu Moosewala's killing shouldn't be given political colour: Supreme Court
127.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday while hearing pleas linked to singer Sidhu Moosewala's killing, said, "Our request is that such matters should not be connected politically." The bench said, "We don't appreciate this. This court has to work openly for all the people. But it should not be given any political colour." It dismissed a plea seeking a CBI probe.

128.title: Aaditya Thackeray brings kids to Aarey protests, NCPCR seeks FIR
128.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) sought an FIR against Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray for allegedly using children during 'Save Aarey' protests. The child rights body asked Mumbai Police to submit an Action Taken Report, along with the statement of the children within 3 days. The commission asked the police to investigate the matter urgently.

129.title: BYJU'S struggles to close $800 million funding round
129.article_body: BYJU'S is struggling to close a funding round of $800 million. A spokeswoman said on Monday that investors, including Sumeru Ventures and Oxshott, haven't transferred about $250 million of the targeted amount due to "macroeconomic reasons". However, the firm's Co-founder Byju Raveendran has completed an injection of about $400 million into the startup as part of the round, she added.

130.title: Ashish Bhatia and Nandini win Sonu Sood-hosted MTV Roadies 18
130.article_body: Ashish Bhatia and Nandini have emerged winners of the Sonu Sood-hosted MTV Roadies 18. Apart from Ashish and Nandini, the other finalists included Kevin Almasifar-Moose Jattana, Yukti Arora-Jaswanth Bopanna and Gaurav Alugh-Simi Talsania. The season of the show was shot in South Africa's Cape Town. "I cannot describe how amazing this is for me," Nandini said.

131.title: I wanted to encourage him: Fan accused of having 700 drinks by Kyrgios at Wimbledon final
131.article_body: The fan accused by Nick Kyrgios of having '700 drinks' during the Wimbledon men's final said that she "only had good intentions". The fan, who was ejected for distracting Kyrgios, added, "He always says the crowd is against him, and I wanted to show we were for him, I wanted to encourage him."

132.title: Rising Chinese invasion & PM's silence harmful for country: Rahul
132.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that the increasing Chinese infiltration and PM Modi's silence on it are "very harmful" for the country. He also shared five "truths" about PM Modi, alleging that he's afraid of China, hides the truth from the public, lowers the morale of the Army and plays with the security of the country.

133.title: Digital health platform MFine merges with LifeCell International
133.article_body: Digital healthcare startup MFine will merge with the diagnostic arm of Chennai-based LifeCell International to form a merged entity called LifeWell, according to the company's Co-founder Prasad Kompalli. LifeWell has raised $80 million from New York-based healthcare investment firm OrbiMed.  Bengaluru-based MFine was founded by former Myntra executives Prasad Kompalli and Ashutosh Lawania in 2017.

134.title: Centre, K'taka govt hold 2-day good governance conference in B'luru
134.article_body: Centre in collaboration with the Karnataka government is holding a two-day conference in Bengaluru from Monday on bringing citizens and government closer through administrative reforms, a PIB release said. Union Minister Jitendra Singh and Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai will grace the valedictory session of "Bringing citizens, entrepreneurs and government closer for good governance" on Tuesday.

135.title: Ambulance service suspended in parts of Sri Lanka amid fuel crisis
135.article_body: Amid fuel shortages in crisis-hit Sri Lanka, emergency ambulance service has been suspended in several parts of the country. Suwa Seriya Ambulance Service has urged citizens to refrain from calling emergency helpline number 1990 in the affected regions, which include Galle and Hambantota. Sri Lankan Power Minister Kanchana Wijesekera has said that fuel supplies can be expected in few days.

136.title: ED issues fresh summons to Sonia in National Herald case on July 21
136.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has asked Congress chief Sonia Gandhi to appear before it on July 21 for questioning in the National Herald money laundering case. Earlier, she had asked ED to postpone the questioning as she was advised to rest after contracting COVID-19. Her son and Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has been questioned by the ED in this case.

137.title: Still thinking about 'RRR' days later: 'Doctor Strange' screenwriter
137.article_body: Screenwriter Jon Spaihts, known for writing 'Doctor Strange' and 'Dune', praised Ram Charan and Jr NTR-starrer 'RRR'. He shared a still from the movie on Twitter, writing "Holy hell, RRR. Has any movie ever packed more movie into a movie? What a ride. Still thinking about it a couple days later." The SS Rajamouli directorial earned over ₹1,200 crore worldwide.

138.title: The game is fickle: Topley on England's 17-run win vs India in 3rd T20I
138.article_body: After his side's 17-run win against India in third T20I, England pacer Reece Topley, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 3/22, said that the game is fickle. "You got to ride the high when things fall your way because a lot of days it does not...you got to trust your processes and keep delivering," he added.

139.title: Rape accused Hyd Police inspector surrenders, taken in custody
139.article_body: Hyderabad Police inspector K Nageshwar Rao, who has been booked for the alleged rape of a woman, surrendered before Rachakonda Police on Sunday. Rao, who had been absconding for 24 hours, was taken in custody by a Special Operations Team and Vanasthalipuram police. The case is being investigated by Vanasthalipuram ACP, police said.

140.title: Osmania and JNTU postpone exams amid heavy rainfall in Hyderabad
140.article_body: Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University (JNTU) and Osmania University (OU) have announced the postponement of exams amid heavy rainfall in Hyderabad. JNTU has postponed the various exams of its BTech and BPharm courses scheduled for July 11 and 12. Exams scheduled from July 16 onwards will remain unaffected. Meanwhile, Osmania has postponed exams scheduled from July 11 to July 13.

141.title: New Parliament will fulfil hopes, aspirations of people: Shah
141.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said that the new Parliament building will "become the identity of a self-reliant and new India and will witness the fulfilment of the hopes and aspirations of the people". PM Modi unveiled the National Emblem at the summit of the new Parliament House, which is made of bronze and weighs 9,500 kg.

142.title: You left so much behind: B Praak's wife on losing her second child at birth
142.article_body: Singer B Praak's wife Meera Bachan, who lost her second child at birth last month, shared a post while remembering her child. She wrote, "You will always be my heart and soul, my...heartbeat, my blood...my child, my reason for being and living. You gave me a second life and left so much behind. I'll miss you until we meet again."

143.title: 2 Pune-based scientists win bronze medals in CRSI 2023 awards
143.article_body: Two scientists from Pune have been selected to receive Chemical Research Society of India (CRSI) Bronze Medal of 2023. Sakya Sen and Sujit Ghosh, from CSIR-National Chemical Laboratory (NCL) and Indian Institute of Science Education and Research (IISER) Pune, are among the 30 national-level awardees this year. Gold medals will be presented to Professor Vishwakarma Singh and Professor Ramasesha.

144.title: 6 Thane trekkers lost way in Pune's Bhimashankar forest, rescued
144.article_body: The Pune Rural Police have rescued six trekkers from Thane, who lost their way in Pune's Bhimashankar forest amid heavy rains on Sunday evening. Officials were dispatched to the area after the owner of a local eatery informed them about the situation. The trekkers were stuck in the difficult terrain of high gradient slopes and dangerous cliffs, officials said.

145.title: AAP MP Raghav Chadha appointed Chairman of Punjab advisory panel
145.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has appointed AAP MP Raghav Chadha as the Chairman of a temporary advisory committee to the state government. Chadha will oversee the conception and implementation of pro-people initiatives of the AAP government in the state and advise it on matters of finance, the Chief Minister's Office said.

146.title: Landslide on road leading to Pune's Bhimashankar Temple; no one injured
146.article_body: A landslide took place on a road leading to the Bhimashankar Temple in the Pune district after heavy rains on Monday, officials said. No one was injured in the incident, an official said. The Ghodegaon-Bhimashankar road was partially blocked due to the landslide, but one side of the road was open for vehicular movement.

147.title: One of the oldest Indian tigers, Raja, dies at 25; pic shows tribute being paid to it
147.article_body: Raja, one of the longest-surviving tigers in India, died aged 25 years and 10 months on Monday. The tiger died at 3 am in West Bengal, after which pictures showed people paying tribute to it by laying flower wreaths on its mortal remains. Tigers usually live up to 16 years in the wild and up to 28-30 years in captivity.

148.title: Part of temple collapses amid heavy rainfall in Gujarat, no injuries reported
148.article_body: A part of the Arjunnath temple in Gujarat collapsed on Monday amid heavy rainfall in the state. The Lord Shiva temple is located on the banks of a river in Sankheda. No injuries have been reported following the collapse of a portion of the temple. Over 3,000 people have been evacuated from Gujarat as heavy rainfall is likely to continue.

149.title: Coal India's capital expenditure rises 65% in June quarter
149.article_body: Coal India on Monday said its capital expenditure increased by 65% to ₹3,034 crore in the June quarter of 2022-23. In comparison, its capital expenditure was ₹1,841 crore in the April-June period of last financial year. The increase was driven by strong spending in acquiring land and strengthening transport infrastructure in the coalfields under first-mile connectivity projects, the company said.

150.title: Kohli is not far off from a real special innings: Vaughan
150.article_body: Michael Vaughan has said the "pinnacle point" in the upcoming three-match ODI series between India and England will be Virat Kohli. "India need Virat back to form. They need him to score runs...I've seen glimpses that he is not far off from a real special innings," he added. Kohli scored 1, 11 in recently concluded three-match T20I series against England.

151.title: Blinkit promotes long-time executive Rishi Arora to Co-founder: Report
151.article_body: Quick commerce startup, Blinkit, promoted long-time executive Rishi Arora to Co-founder, two months prior to its acquisition by Zomato, as per a report. Prior to this, Arora had been working as a senior Vice President of Operations for 8 years at the company. Blinkit has also named former Zomato Engineering Manager, Sajal Gupta, as the Chief Technology Officer (CTO).

152.title: You are creating history: PM to Shramjeevis building new Parliament
152.article_body: PM Narendra Modi interacted with workers involved in the construction work of the new Parliament and said that they're making history. "I had a wonderful interaction with the Shramjeevis who have been involved in the making of the Parliament. We are proud of their efforts and will always remember their contribution to our nation," PM Modi said in a tweet.

153.title: Huge flashlight caused by meteor seen in Chile's night sky, pic goes viral
153.article_body: A meteor was recently spotted causing huge flashlight through the night sky over Chile's Santiago. Academics at the Concepción University said that it was a small rock body that burned up upon entering the Earth’s atmosphere. According to local media, the bright flashes of light were accompanied with loud booming sounds.

154.title: Storage in dams supplying water to Pune city increases to 8.70 TMC
154.article_body: Storage in the dams supplying water to Pune city has risen to 8.70 TMC because of a good spell of rain for the last one week, officials said. More rains have been predicted for the next few days in the catchment area of these dams. The water storage was 8.63 TMC last year on the same day, according to officials.

155.title: 5 popular Delhi markets to be revamped, govt to conduct online survey
155.article_body: The Delhi government has begun preliminary work towards revamping five popular markets. The governments will be conducting an online survey of traders of all the five markets to take stock of facilities. Kamla Nagar, Sarojini Nagar, Khari Baoli spice market, Lajpat Nagar and Kirti Nagar furniture markets will be revamped under the project.

156.title: Dileep is innocent in 2017 actress assault case: Former Kerala DGP
156.article_body: Former Kerala Director General of Police Sreelekha claimed on her YouTube channel that Malayalam actor Dileep is 100% innocent and not at all involved in the 2017 actress assault case. Sreelekha further said most of the evidence against Dileep has been fabricated by co-accused Pulsar Suni and his "quotation gang". She alleged police helped Pulsar secure a mobile in prison.

157.title: Pune college introduces course on setting up terrace gardens
157.article_body: Pune's Modern College of Arts, Science and Commerce has decided to introduce a certificate course on setting up terrace gardens. The course will begin on August 15 and the registrations will start in the first week of August. Candidates will be chosen on a first-come-first-serve basis and the course will be open to all students, pensioners, working professionals and homemakers.

158.title: Bihar's Purnea alerted over reports of Nairobi fly attacks in Bengal
158.article_body: The Purnea health administration was on Monday put on high alert over reports of Nairobi fly attacks in Bihar through West Bengal. Medical officers have been directed to spread awareness about how to deal with possible attacks. On July 5, around 100 students of a college in Sikkim suffered from severe skin infections after coming in contact with the flies.

159.title: Heavy rain in Gujarat disrupts power supply in 174 villages
159.article_body: At least 174 villages across Gujarat lost power supply in the heavy rain that affected parts of Gujarat on Sunday. According to IMD, Chhota Udepur received over 166 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours. This is the second-highest rainfall after the Narmada district, which received 168 mm in the last 24 hours, ending at 8 am on Monday.

160.title: SpiceJet refutes reports of surprise check by DGCA & windshield crack incident
160.article_body: SpiceJet on Monday refuted reports that claimed that the windshield of one of its aircraft cracked minutes after departure from Chennai, while another flight was delayed by six hours after DGCA’s surprise inspection. On July 9, media reports emerged that a SpiceJet flight from Mumbai to Srinagar was delayed for six hours because of DGCA's surprise audit of the aircraft.

161.title: 3 men, aged 22-26, drown in waterfall in UP's Mirzapur
161.article_body: Three young men drowned in the Chuna Dari waterfall in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur district. The waterfall was immediately closed for the tourists after the incident and rescue operations went underway, police said. The deceased, identified as Sandeep Kharwar (26), Prince (23) and Rishu (22), had come from Varanasi. Notably, the three deceased didn't know how to swim, police added.

162.title: 3 people gored during 5th bull run at festival in Spain's Pamplona
162.article_body: Three people were gored and three others were bruised during the fifth bull run at Pamplona's San Fermín Festival in Spain on Monday, a Spanish Red Cross spokesperson said. While there will be three more bull runs till Thursday, this is the first one in which someone was gored this year. One of the gored people is Australian.

163.title: Have over ₹2,800 cr in our bank yet we aren’t efficient: Unacademy CEO tells staff
163.article_body: In an internal note to the employees, Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal announced a series of cost-cutting measures. He said, "Even though we have over ₹2,800 crore in the bank, we aren't efficient at all...There are a lot of unnecessary expenses we do...We must turn profitable asap." "These changes might seem we are in a bad state...We are not," he added.

164.title: Russian shelling in Ukraine's Kharkiv killed 3, injured 31: Guv
164.article_body: Three people were killed and 31 others were injured due to shelling by Russian forces in Ukraine's Kharkiv, the regional governor claimed. The city's Mayor Ihor Terekhov said that the shelling hit places "which had no military significance". He added that two children aged four and 16 were among the people who were taken to a hospital.

165.title: Woman killed after jumping in front of metro in Kolkata, services disrupted
165.article_body: A woman died after jumping in front of an approaching metro train at Girish Park station in West Bengal's Kolkata on Monday. The incident occurred around 12:35 pm and metro services were disrupted for around 50 minutes. Officials said they are trying to identify the woman and find her family members. They are investigating the matter and checking CCTV footage.

166.title: No free meals for staff, founders & top management to take salary cut: Unacademy
166.article_body: In an internal note to the staff, Unacademy's CEO Gaurav Munjal said that firm's founders and top management will take pay cuts, and the company will also shut its global test preparation business in a bid to turn profitable. He also put travel restrictions on employees, removed dedicated drivers for CXOs and stopped complimentary meals and snacks at their offices.

167.title: Centre should invite Oppn to events related to Parliament: Ex-Cong MP
167.article_body: As PM Narendra Modi unveiled the National Emblem on the new Parliament building on Monday, ex-Congress MP Sandeep Dikshit said the Centre should invite Opposition leaders as well to the events and functions related to the Parliament. "The Parliament does not belong to a single party, government or a PM...It belongs to every elected member of the Parliament," he added.

168.title: We've stable govt, don't need anyone: Goa CM on Cong's defection accusation
168.article_body: After AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao said a "conspiracy" was led by two of their leaders by "hobnobbing" with BJP to ensure defection in Congress in Goa, CM Pramod Sawant said, "We don't need anyone, we've a stable government with support of 25 MLAs." Furthermore, he said, "Since they (Congress) have nothing to do, they're doing this blame-game drama."

169.title: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's judicial custody extended till July 20
169.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday extended Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's judicial custody till July 20 in a money laundering case. ED has carried out at least two rounds of raids against his family members and associates. The probe agency claimed to have seized cash worth ₹2.85 crore and 133 gold coins after raids conducted against his family and others.

170.title: Suryakumar needed supporting role from someone in his 117-run innings: Sehwag
170.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said Suryakumar Yadav needed "supporting role" from other batters in his 117-run innings in the third T20I against England. "Shreyas did support him for some time, but the batters after that did not give him company. Such a knock would have looked better if it was on the winning side," stated Sehwag. Shreyas scored 28(23).

171.title: TDP will back Murmu for Presidential polls: Chandrababu Naidu
171.article_body: Telugu Desam Party chief and former Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu said that his party will vote for NDA's Droupadi Murmu in the upcoming Presidential polls. Naidu said that it would be "wonderful to see her [Murmu]" become the first tribal woman President. With this, Andhra Pradesh's two main political parties, YSRCP and TDP, have declared to support Murmu.

172.title: Over 3,000 people evacuated amid heavy rains in Gujarat: Officials
172.article_body: Over 3,000 people have been evacuated from Gujarat as heavy rains lashed the state and the meteorological department's forecast showed that heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely to continue over the next five days in several districts. Officials said that 400 people have been evacuated from Chhotaudepur, which received 433 mm of rainfall in just 12 hours.

173.title: Who is Sneha Pareek, the only girl JEE Main 2022 topper who scored 300/300?
173.article_body: Out of the 14 students who scored 100 percentile in JEE Main 2022 Session 1, Guwahati’s Sneha Pareek is the only girl topper who scored 300/300. She wants to pursue BTech in Computer Science. "I'm willing to join any IIT that offers my desired course. If it comes as a preferred choice, I will opt for IIT-Bombay," she said.

174.title: 'Dhaakad' was removed from cinemas even before I could watch it: Saswata
174.article_body: Saswata Chatterjee, who was recently seen in Kangana Ranaut-fronted 'Dhaakad', has said he fails to understand why the movie didn't work. "It was a big project. It was removed from [cinemas]...even before I could watch it," he added. 'Dhaakad', which was made on an estimated budget of ₹85 crore, managed to earn only ₹2.58 crore in India, according to reports.

175.title: Abe killed by ex-serviceman, BJP playing with fire on Agnipath: TMC
175.article_body: The TMC has cautioned Centre over new military recruitment scheme Agnipath by pointing out that ex-Japan PM Shinzo Abe was assassinated by a short-service ex-serviceman.
