349.title: Oath Keeper brought explosives to DC ahead of Capitol riot: US DOJ
349.article_body: The US Department of Justice (DOJ) has said in a court filing that a member of the Oath Keepers extremist group brought explosives to the Washington, DC area ahead of the January 6 Capitol riot. Prosecutors have alleged that Jeremy Brown, an Oath Keepers member from Florida, transported explosives to a Virginia hotel in his recreational vehicle on January 6.

350.title: SEBI may issue 'risk factor disclosures' on market trends: Report
350.article_body: The SEBI is reportedly planning to issue "risk factor disclosures" on market trends, including surges and collapses, to help investors make better decisions. Sources told PTI that the regulator has huge amounts of datasets and is in a position to analyse things that have gone good or bad for the investors. The disclosures might be made annually, half-yearly or quarterly.

351.title: How much prize money did Wimbledon winners and runners up get?
351.article_body: Serbia's Novak Djokovic and Kazakhstan's Elena Rybakina, who won the men's and women's singles titles, respectively, at the Wimbledon this year, won £2,000,000 (nearly ₹19 crore) each as prize money. Meanwhile, men's singles runner up Australia's Nick Kyrgios and women's singles runner up Tunisia's Ons Jabeur won £1,050,000 (nearly ₹10 crore) each.

352.title: Sara upset with Karan for confirming relationship with Kartik: Report
352.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan is upset with filmmaker Karan Johar for confirming her past relationship with actor Kartik Aaryan, Bollywood Life reported quoting a source. Kartik and Sara starred together in 2020 film 'Love Aaj Kal' and reportedly began dating during filming. Sara had also spoken about wanting to date Kartik during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan' in 2018.

353.title: Ferrari's Leclerc wins 3rd F1 race of 2022 at Austrian GP after late issue
353.article_body: Ferrari's Charles Leclerc overcame a late throttle problem to win his third Formula One race of 2022 at Austrian Grand Prix on Sunday. Red Bull's Verstappen came second, while Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton completed the podium for the third race in a row. "I definitely needed that one...last five races have been incredibly difficult for myself and...the team," said Leclerc.

354.title: Suryakumar Yadav becomes 5th Indian to smash a hundred in men's T20I cricket history
354.article_body: Batter Suryakumar Yadav has become the fifth Indian to smash a hundred in men's T20I cricket history. The 31-year-old slammed his maiden T20I hundred off 48 deliveries against England in the third T20I in Nottingham. Suresh Raina, Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Deepak Hooda are the other four Indians to have slammed centuries in men's T20I cricket.

355.title: 3 people shoot dead Chhattisgarh couple after being denied alcohol
355.article_body: Three unidentified persons allegedly shot a couple to death in Chhattisgarh’s Jashpur district on Saturday night after they were allegedly denied alcohol, police said. According to the police, the unknown assailants reached the couple's residence and demanded traditional liquor made from the 'mahua' tree, which the couple refused to provide. The crime took place in Gaimunda Navapara village.

356.title: US-backed defence pact with Arab nations will threaten peace: Iran
356.article_body: Iran on Saturday warned that plans for a security alliance between the US, Israel and Arab nations to counter Iranian drones and missiles would jeopardise peace in the Middle East. US and Israel are reportedly seeking to lay the groundwork for an alliance with Arab nations, allowing the integration of air defence systems to counter Iranian missile and drone strikes.

357.title: YouTuber Gaurav shares permit to celebrate b'day in Noida metro after arrest, paid ₹38,000
357.article_body: After being released on bail, YouTuber Gaurav Taneja (Flying Beast), has shared a picture of a permission letter to celebrate his birthday inside a metro by Noida Metro Rail Corporation. The letter stated he paid nearly ₹38,000 to avail the facility from 2pm-3pm. He was arrested after thousands of people gathered at a Noida metro station to celebrate his birthday.

358.title: New COVID-19 Omicron subvariant found in China's Shanghai
358.article_body: A new subvariant of the COVID-19 Omicron virus has been found in China's Shanghai, a city official said on Sunday. Authorities identified an Omicron BA.5.2.1 case in the financial district of Pudong on July 8, Vice-Director of Shanghai's Health Commission Zhao Dandan said as per Reuters. It is linked to a case from overseas, Dandan has said.

359.title: Fan posts Kareena, Sujoy's pic; latter asks 'How do you get these'
359.article_body: Taking to Twitter, a fan posted a photo of actress Kareena Kapoor and director Sujoy Ghosh from 'The Devotion of Suspect X' sets. In the photo, Kareena wore a checked blue shirt as she stood next to Sujoy with her hand on his shoulder. Resharing the photo on his Twitter account, Sujoy wrote, "How do you get these photos?"

360.title: When will everyone stop asking: Shruti to fan asking about wedding
360.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan recently conducted an interactive question and answer session on social media. A social media user asked her, "When will you marry dear?" to which the actress responded, "When will everyone stop asking dear." She said along with the answer, "It was a big eye roll, for your information." Shruti is dating visual artist Santanu Hazarika.

361.title: Nicki Minaj says she's not fat but pregnant, later says she's not pregnant
361.article_body: Rapper Nicki Minaj conducted a Live session on Instagram and addressed the rumours of her pregnancy during the session. She said, "I did mean to tweet this. I'm not fat, y'all, I'm pregnant." The rapper read the congratulatory messages and corrected herself, saying, "I'm sorry, I think I said it wrong. I meant to say I'm not pregnant, I'm fat."

362.title: It was like time slowed down: Ranveer on first meeting with Deepika
362.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh spoke about his first meeting with his wife actress Deepika Padukone, saying it was at filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali's house. "It was almost like time had slowed down. That was it for me," Ranveer said. He added that "sparks were flying almost instantaneously". The couple got married in 2018 in an intimate ceremony in Italy's Lake Como.

363.title: 4th Sri Lankan Cabinet minister resigns amid ongoing economic crisis
363.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's ongoing economic crisis, Sri Lankan Minister of Investment Promotion, Dhammika Perera, resigned from his post on Sunday. Perera is the fourth Cabinet minister to step down after Harin Fernando, Manusha Nanayakkara and Bandula Gunawardana. This comes as Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has also offered to resign, calling for the formation of an all-party government.

364.title: I was beaten by my parents after they found my love letter: Sai Pallavi
364.article_body: Actress Sai Pallavi revealed she was beaten by her parents after they found out about a love letter she had written to a boy when she was young. "I wrote a letter to a boy, it was in my childhood," she added. "Maybe when I was in my 7th standard. I was caught. My parents hit me hard," she said.

365.title: Djokovic beats Kyrgios to win 4th consecutive Wimbledon title, bags his 21st Grand Slam
365.article_body: World number three Novak Djokovic defeated world number 40 Nick Kyrgios in the men's singles final on Sunday to win his fourth consecutive Wimbledon title. Djokovic won the match with a scoreline of 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3) in three hours. With the victory, Djokovic has now taken his tally of Grand Slam titles to 21.

366.title: Happy to be defined by action, proud to be typecast: Vidyut Jammwal
366.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal has stated that he is happy to be defined by the action genre, adding that he feels proud of being typecast. "It's not an easy place to be in when you get typecast for being the best at what you do," the actor added. Vidyut was last seen in 'Khuda Haafiz: Chapter 2 – Agni Pariksha'.

367.title: I would've played Hooda instead of Iyer in 3rd T20I vs England: RP Singh
367.article_body: RP Singh said batter Deepak Hooda should've played instead of Shreyas Iyer in third T20I against England as the former was in form. "But by playing Iyer, you're trying to get him back in his form which is beyond my understanding. If I was...captain, I would've played Hooda," he added. Hooda has scored 184 runs in his last three T20Is.

368.title: U'khand MLA, 59 others get stuck as ropeway halts for 25 minutes; rescued
368.article_body: At least 60 people, including BJP MLA Kishore Upadhyay, were stuck after a ropeway at Surkanda Devi Temple in Uttarakhand stopped for 20 to 25 minutes due to a technical fault. All the passengers have come out safely and the ropeway is now running smoothly, Tehri Garhwal SSP Navneet Bhullar said. No passenger is trapped in the trolley, he added.

369.title: Congress' allegation that govt is snatching tribal rights holds no ground: Arjun Munda
369.article_body: Union Minister Arjun Munda reacted to Congress' criticism of Forest (Conservation) Rules, 2022, saying the allegation that the Centre is trying to snatch tribal rights has no ground. Munda said Congress was trying to divert attention from the fact that NDA's presidential candidate is a tribal lady. "The Centre is totally committed for upliftment of the tribal communities," he added.

370.title: Centre shouldn't adopt a 'touch-me-not' attitude: Ex-EAM Khurshid
370.article_body: Ex-External Affairs Minister Salman Khurshid on Sunday advised Centre against adopting a "touch-me-not" attitude, days after Germany criticised Alt News co-founder Mohammed Zubair's arrest. "If we don't want an adverse opinion we must show the best side of us [to other countries]," Khurshid said. India had called Germany's comments "uninformed" after latter condemned journalists' 'persecution'.

371.title: Goa Congress removes Michael Lobo as Leader of Oppn for planning defections to BJP
371.article_body: Goa Congress has removed Michael Lobo as the Leader of Opposition with immediate effect, AICC Goa In-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao announced on Sunday. "A conspiracy was hatched by some of our own leaders with BJP to see that the Congress party in Goa is weakened and to engineer defections," Rao said. He said Lobo and Digambar Kamat led the conspiracy.

372.title: England record their highest-ever total against India in T20I cricket
372.article_body: England put up a total of 215/7 in their 20 overs against India in the third T20I in Nottingham today. This is England's highest total against India in T20I cricket. This is the second time England touched 200-run mark against India in T20Is. England's previous highest T20I total against India had come on September 19, 2007, when they registered 200/6.

373.title: IndiGo technicians go on mass leave over poor hike after mass leave by crew: Reports
373.article_body: IndiGo's aircraft maintenance technicians at major hubs like Delhi and Hyderabad took mass leave recently to protest poor increment, reports said on Sunday. This came days after the airline's flights were delayed across the country as the crew reportedly took mass sick leave to attend Air India's recruitment drive. IndiGo announced 8% hike for crew and pilots after the incident.

374.title: Rybakina's Wimbledon win not a surprise: Kazakhstan tennis chief
374.article_body: Kazakhstan Tennis Federation President Bulat Utemuratov said Elena Rybakina's Wimbledon win was not a surprise. "Elena had been improving on a consistent basis and heading towards this type of success for some time," he added. Rybakina, who was born in Moscow, switched allegiance to Kazakhstan four years ago to gain more financial support. It was 23-year-old's maiden Grand Slam title.

375.title: Hope that India will continue to help Sri Lanka: Sonia Gandhi
375.article_body: Congress expressed solidarity with Sri Lanka and its people amid the ongoing crisis in the country. In a message, Congress chief Sonia Gandhi said, "We hope that India will continue to assist the people and government of Sri Lanka as they deal with the difficulties of the current situation." Congress urged the international community to extend help to Sri Lanka.

376.title: Ranveer Singh buys luxury quadruplex for ₹119 crore in Mumbai's Bandra: Report
376.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has bought a quadruplex apartment in Mumbai's Bandra West for ₹118.94 crore, as per documents accessed by IndexTap. Ranveer has purchased the apartment through his company Oh Five Oh Media Works. The sea-facing property on Mumbai's Bandstand area is spread across the 16th, 17th, 18th and 19th floors, with a total carpet area of 11,266 sq ft.

377.title: Govt requests BCCI to organise India-World XI match to celebrate 75th I-Day: Reports
377.article_body: The Indian government has requested the BCCI to organise India-Rest of the World XI match to commemorate 75 years of Indian independence, reports said. The government has sent a proposal to BCCI to organise the match on August 22, reports added. If finalised, the match is likely to be held at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi.

378.title: My 'Stranger...' co-stars & I've group where they send 'RoNance' memes: Natalia
378.article_body: 'Stranger Things' actress Natalia Dyer revealed how fans aren't only shipping her with characters of Steve and Jonathan but also Maya Hawke's Robin. "There are things about both Steve and Jonathan that Nancy...likes. I noticed...there's a lot of 'RoNance' shipping as well. I love Nancy having a girlfriend," she said. "We send each other memes...regarding that ship," she added.

379.title: Crypto exchange CoinFLEX sues user over $84-mn debt in Hong Kong
379.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange CoinFLEX has sued a customer in Hong Kong to recover an $84-million debt. The customer is reportedly cryptocurrency exchange Bitcoin.com's CEO Roger Ver. Earlier, CoinFLEX accused Ver of defaulting on a $47 million margin call. It has now said that the amount owned by the "individual" has increased after calculating the loss in liquidating his FLEX coin positions.

380.title: Punjab govt suspends 4 officers for constructing road during rains
380.article_body: The Punjab government has suspended four Public Works Department (PWD) officers for constructing a road amid heavy rains in the Hoshiarpur district. Sub-divisional engineer Tarsem Singh, along with three junior engineers, Vipan Kumar, Jasbir Singh and Parveen Kumar were suspended. The action was taken after a video went viral on social media, showing the workers constructing amid heavy rainfall.

381.title: 8-year-old boy seen sitting with 2-year-old brother's body on roadside in MP
381.article_body: An eight-year-old boy was seen sitting with his two-year-old brother's body on a roadside in Madhya Pradesh's Morena. The boy's father was looking for a vehicle to take them home after the hospital, where the two-year-old died during treatment, denied providing an ambulance citing unavailability, according to reports. They were reportedly provided an ambulance later after police intervention.

382.title: 3 killed, 4 injured as speeding truck hits van on Gujarat highway
382.article_body: Three persons died and four others sustained injuries in a collision between a speeding truck and a van on Pipali-Vataman Highway on the outskirts of Gujarat's Ahmedabad, police said. "The victims were traveling towards Kheda when the vehicle hit a truck in Dhandhuka area," an officer said. The condition of two of the injured passengers is said to be critical.

383.title: Arjun Bijlani and I are from same school, same football team: Ranbir
383.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor recently appeared on television show 'Ravivaar with Star Parivaar' hosted by Arjun Bijlani. A video going viral on social media shows Ranbir saying that he is from the school as Arjun, adding they played in the same house's football team together. "I'm proud of where we are right now and hope to always stay grounded," Ranbir said.

384.title: WI need to improve playing spin, swing: Pooran ahead of Bangladesh ODIs
384.article_body: Ahead of the three-match ODI series between West Indies and Bangladesh, West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said the team needs to have the right mindset and template for the format, adding they need to stick with it for a bit. Pooran further said that his team needs to improve the batting against spin and swing in the series.

385.title: PM Modi will meet same fate as Sri Lankan Prez Rajapaksa: TMC MLA
385.article_body: TMC MLA Idris Ali on Sunday said PM Modi will meet the same fate as Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, who was forced to leave his official residence after anti-government protesters stormed into his official residence. According to reports, his remarks came after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee wasn't invited to the inauguration of the Sealdah Metro station in Kolkata.

386.title: Foster religious harmony by respecting other faiths: Karnataka CM
386.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday spoke of the importance of fostering religious harmony by respecting other faiths and added that establishing religious harmony was important for promoting social equality. He made the remark while speaking at a programme organised in memory of retired engineer-in-chief Dr L Shivalingaiah. Shivalingaiah was an inspiration for the youth, he said.

387.title: Heard's insurer refuses to partly pay $8mn owed to Depp, says she 'wilfully defamed' him
387.article_body: Amber Heard's insurance firm, New York Marine and General Insurance Co, has refused to cover a portion of the $8.35 million that the actress owes to her ex-husband Johnny Depp as part of their defamation trial settlement. The company said it wasn't liable to cover the damages for Amber due to her 'wilful', 'malicious' act of defaming Depp.

388.title: I've been criticised for doing 'Koffee with Karan' for so many years: Karan
388.article_body: Karan Johar said that he has been trolled for doing 'Koffee With Karan'. "I've been criticised for doing the show for so many years. So many blames and things have been attributed to me," he added. "If I'm not taking my own show seriously, why are you taking it...It's just meant to be fun and games," he said.

389.title: SEBI mulls bringing mutual fund units under insider trading rules
389.article_body: The SEBI has proposed to bring transactions in mutual fund units under insider trading regulations. Insiders would include those who have access to unpublished price-sensitive information and their immediate relatives. In the past, a few key personnel of a mutual fund redeemed their holdings in the schemes while in possession of "sensitive information", the SEBI noted in its discussion paper.

390.title: RBI to release norms for digital lending this month: Report
390.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will release guidelines for 'Buy Now, Pay Later' (BNPL) service and digital lending later this month, Financial Express reported. A circular could be out as early as next week, the report added. Last month, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said the regulator would introduce a framework to curb malpractices in the digital lending segment.

391.title: New forest rules are reformative, we're committed to protect Adivasi rights: Govt
391.article_body: After Congress criticised the Forest (Conservation) Rules, 2022, Union Minister Bhupender Yadav said the rules are reformative with an objective to streamline the process of approvals under the Forest Rights Act. He also called Congress' allegations that the rules will disempower tribals "ill-informed" and said, "Government under Narendra Modi ji remains committed to protecting Adivasis' rights."

392.title: Tiger Shroff shares fan art showing him as Dragon Ball Z's Goku
392.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff on Sunday took to Instagram Stories to share a fan's artwork which depicts him as the character Goku from Japanese anime television series 'Dragon Ball Z'. The fan shared the artwork on Instagram, writing, "@tigerjackieshroff As a Goku... In #ganapath Style. Kesa laga?" Tiger shared the art, along with the caption, "Love this thank [you] so much."

393.title: 76 dead in rain-related incidents in Maha so far this monsoon
393.article_body: Around 76 people have succumbed to rain-related incidents in Maharashtra during the ongoing monsoon season so far, a report by the state disaster management authorities said on Sunday. Of the total number of deceased, nine people died on Saturday, while as many as 125 animals have died since June 1 with rains lashing parts of the state.

394.title: Can't keep picking a player due to his past performances: Vaughan on Kohli
394.article_body: Speaking about Virat Kohli's place in the playing XI following his one off three balls against England in the second T20I, Michael Vaughan stated he's sure head coach Rahul Dravid and captain Rohit Sharma are not considering dropping him. "But you can't just keep picking a player because of what he has done in the past," he added.

395.title: 22-yr-old Mumbai man kills mother over property dispute, attempts suicide
395.article_body: A 22-year-old man from Mumbai's Mulund allegedly killed his mother on Saturday evening and later tried to end his own life. The man had allegedly left a suicide note, apologising to his father for his action, police said. Police added that the accused had committed the crime as he was depressed over some issues related to property.

396.title: 63 pilgrims from Maharashtra's Beed stranded in Amarnath rescued
396.article_body: As many as 63 pilgrims from Maharashtra's Beed who got stranded during the Amarnath pilgrimage were rescued and taken to Jammu, Srinagar and other places, an official has said. The pilgrims had got stranded near the Amarnath temple shrine. At least 16 people were killed and several others were reported missing in flash floods triggered by a cloudburst on Friday.

397.title: Drugs worth ₹10 cr seized from vehicle in Assam's Kamrup district
397.article_body: Police in Assam's Kamrup district seized drugs worth ₹10 crore from a mini-truck with an 'On Telecom Duty' sticker on Saturday night, a police official said. The seized drugs include five kgs of opium and 2,000 tablets, the official added. The occupants of the vehicle managed to escape and an operation is underway to locate them, he further informed.

398.title: Prithviraj apologises for 'Kaduva' dialogue on differently-abled children
398.article_body: Actor Prithviraj Sukumaran apologised for a dialogue in Malayalam film 'Kaduva' saying differently-abled children are born with their conditions due to the sins of their parents. He also shared director Shaji Kailas' statement in Malayalam which said that they only wanted to convey the villain's cruelty. Earlier, State Commissioner for Persons with Disabilities had issued a notice to the makers.

399.title: Govt unveils challenge to develop tech to reduce rotting of onions
399.article_body: The Centre has launched a Grand Challenge on Onion Storage for students, startups and corporates, asking them to develop technologies that reduce damage and rotting of onions. The challenge comes amid rising onion prices, and was launched by Department of Consumer Affairs on their Twitter handle. According to the Department, onion prices rose 2.3% in June from May.

400.title: 700 J&K youths recruited by terror groups in past 4.5 yrs: MHA data
400.article_body: As many as 700 youths from J&K have been recruited by terror groups in the past four-and-a-half years, according to Union Home Ministry statistics. As per the data, 82 foreign terrorists and 59 local terrorists were active in the union territory as on July 5, 2022. Security forces have eliminated 125 terrorists so far this year, the data further said.

401.title: Amarnath Yatra suspended from Jammu due to inclement weather conditions
401.article_body: The Amarnath Yatra has been suspended from Jammu due to inclement weather conditions, two days after a cloudburst near the shrine. No fresh batch was allowed to proceed from the city to the cave shrine. At least 16 people were killed and several went missing in the incident on July 8.

402.title: Pacer Richard Gleeson is a huge find for English cricket: Morgan
402.article_body: Calling Richard Gleeson's debut remarkable, ex-England captain Eoin Morgan said the 34-year-old pacer is a huge find for English cricket. "And one they can build towards the next World Cup and possibly the next 50-over World Cup next year," he added. Gleeson made his debut against India in second T20I in Birmingham on Saturday. He posted bowling figures of 4-1-15-3.
